issue.title: The button "Create new receving address" is gryed out
issue.body:
<!-- This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to Bitcoin Core.

General bitcoin questions and/or support requests are best directed to the Bitcoin StackExchange at https://bitcoin.stackexchange.com.

For reporting security issues, please read instructions at https://bitcoincore.org/en/contact/.

If the node is "stuck" during sync or giving "block checksum mismatch" errors, please ensure your hardware is stable by running memtest and observe CPU temperature with a load-test tool such as linpack before creating an issue! -->

<!-- Describe the issue -->

**Expected behavior**
In the past, I was able to create a new receiving address with the button on the receiving tag. 
<!--- What behavior did you expect? -->

**Actual behavior**
Since I don't know when the button is grayed out. (I didn't receive Bitcoins for some years now.) Regardless of the Label, Message, or Checkbox values.
When I create a new Wallet I can create new addresses. 
<!--- What was the actual behavior (provide screenshots if the issue is GUI-related)? -->

**To reproduce**

<!--- How reliably can you reproduce the issue, what are the steps to do so? -->
I'm not able to reproduce this behavior with another Wallet.

**System information**
<!-- What version of Bitcoin Core are you using, where did you get it (website, self-compiled, etc)? -->
I was on version 0.18. So I upgraded to version 0.21. No change. 

<!-- What type of machine are you observing the error on (OS/CPU and disk type)? -->


<!-- GUI-related issue? What is your operating system and its version? If Linux, what is your desktop environment and graphical shell? -->
The System is a PC with Windows 10 with an HDD for DB Storage.

<!-- Any extra information that might be useful in the debugging process. -->
I attached the debug.log shortened to on start and stop of the application.
<!--- This is normally the contents of a `debug.log` or `config.log` file. Raw text or a link to a pastebin type site are preferred. -->
![screenshot_20210211_123814](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12497441/107633654-ae346500-6c68-11eb-95b5-cf3f3c5a45b1.png)
[debugDefault.log](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/files/5965013/debugDefault.log)

events.body:
Is it the same as https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/issues/105?
Does #20230 fix it?

Closing and reopening the wallet didn't change the behavior.
The console command "getnewaddress" returns the Error: This wallet has no available keys (code -4)
so I tried "keypoolrefill" no change so far.
If I try "keypoolrefill 100" I get "Error refreshing keypool (code -4)"

I'm trying to do a rescan and see if it solves the problem.
https://bitcoin.org/en/release/v0.15.0#rescanning-with-encrypted-wallets
What is the result of the `getwalletinfo` command?
Try using the `upgradewallet` command. This seems to be a similar situation to #20871 where your wallet version indicates it should support HD, but there is no HD seed so it doesn't actually.

`upgradewallet` did the trick.
thx a lot.
Hi... I have Bitcoin Core Version v0.21.0 installed and face this problem also with Bitcoin Knots. Any hint to resolve the problem would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!

Hebasto, wow - thanx for that swift response.
upgradewallet tells me: "already at latest version. Wallet version unchanged."
tried v0.21.0rc5 - problem does still exist.
v0.20.1 works... what would you recommend me to do now?
